website_summaries.verdict: The Beyerdynamic DT 1990 Pro is a solid pair of headphones for engineers, delivering a detailed, accurate frequency response capable of reaching down for deep lows in the mix.
pros: Exceptionally accurate audio performance with rich bass depth, detail, and clarity in the highs
Comfortable fit with removable earpads that offer slightly differing sound signatures
cons: No inline remote or mic on included cables
Replacing the earpads can be annoying

customer_reviews.title: DT 1990 PRO
customer_reviews.text: Simply the Worst set of Over Ear Headphones I've ever used. Ridiculously heavy, Hard on the Ear Cartilage and Skin around the ears and the Jack socket is poorly designed as it gets in the Way only ALL the time. Because of Ill-Fitting, there is too much bleed to appreciate how well these probably sound. Really very very disappointed indeed and especially, given the price Aindre
customer_reviews.author: GymnCaina

customer_reviews.title: Fast Delivery. The best build quality I've seen from any pair of headphones. But..
customer_reviews.text: ..the sound quality was not what I was after. I'm not sure how to describe it, but the sound was very sharp and dry. I'm sure this is the perfect pair of headphones for professional studio mixing, but it didn't have the smoothness that the Sennheiser HD600 offered. If I were a professional studio mixer, I may opt for the DT 1990. However, I ended up returning them and bought the Sennheisers instead.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Lau

customer_reviews.title: Harsh, sibilant treble. Tiring listening
customer_reviews.text: I hoped these headphones would sound clear and give extra clarity to my music, which includes Tidal Masters. Unfortunately, the top end is so bright as to be uncomfortably sibilant. Efforts to tame this using eq merely make the listening experience dull. The mids are too recessed and the bass feels overwhelmed by that dominating top end. It's also a tiring listen. I've used them with various sources and the top end remains intrusive. It's less of a problem with my phone, but only because I can subdue the sibilance. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: A. J. S. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional sound and comfort, not sure about build quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones and I hope I received a bad unit, because I will order another one. After 1 week of light use and very gentle handling, I accidentally noticed a crack on the headband clamp. I don't remember seeing this upon opening the package, because I checked the unit thoroughly. I will have to send this back and I hope the new unit will last longer. Sound is exceptional. Comfort is very good also.
customer_reviews.author: Tamas

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I've found. I've had about seven/eight headphones over the years, not counting in ears. These have better bass (plenty of detail but also weight and slam) than much more expensive Grado PS1000e also less harsh trebles. More clarity/presence overall than more expensive Beyerdynamic T1 mk2. Good sound staging and ambience. I think excellent value for the price, and 4 stars for sound quality means it's very good in my book (and for my ears obviously)
customer_reviews.author: kds

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Look great but not worth the money. My audio techica M50 X sound better fact. Don't be a audio snob and get sucked in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breathtaking
customer_reviews.text: One of the best pairs of headphones I've had, goes well with a Schiit Stack and doesn't need a lot to drive them to offer the best quality, amazing sound stage, analytical pads are definitely better for me if you want less bass and more detail
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Teasdale

customer_reviews.title: Best headphone experience ever, comfortable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Beyerdynamic produce the best audio equipment on the market by miles in my opinion, best build quality , german made , comfortable , highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: PeterTc

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Some people say this headphone is too bright and I have no idea what they are talking about. This headphone has an amazing high end that is so detailed and crisp. It packs a decent punch in the low end considering it is open backed and the mids are beautiful also. The headphone is extremely comfortable and I can use them for ages. If your on the fence about buying a pair, buy them you won't regret it
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: DT 1990 rock solid
customer_reviews.text: Best headphone I ever had. So much easier to run comparing to DT 990, the clarity, separation and bass its just awesome. They got rid off all bad things that were annoying in 990s like bright highs and recessed vocals plus bass is more like 770s maybe not that powerful but not far off. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Konrad

customer_reviews.title: Top notch headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of headphones, very detailed, made me rediscover my music collection. A bit boosted bass but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Georgios Rovolis

customer_reviews.title: The sound stage is amazing as you would expect at this price range ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth all the money but it could sound a bit bright for a very few poeople or for people who are used to use very warm headphones. The sound stage is amazing as you would excpect at this price range of open back headphones.
customer_reviews.author: botey

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 headphones
customer_reviews.text: Just wow. My first audiophile headphones and probably the last one for a very long time. I started hearing details in music that I have never noticed or heard before. Music sounds alive and so much more fun, and gaming with these are an absolute blast as well. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kartik Vashistha

customer_reviews.title: great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent with analytical pads for mixing all kinds of electronic music. Switched to these from dt 990 and these are a step up, the dt1990 headphones tend to agree on mix mistakes with my monitors.
customer_reviews.author: pwl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound but Not for people who were glasses  .
customer_reviews.text: Sound awesome I use it with sugden headmaster headphone amp the only thing is they're not for listening for long periods for people who were glasses . Can be very tight fit around the head area if you wear glasses and be very uncomfortable .
customer_reviews.author: zulfiqar Ali

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound quality when driven by a decent amp. Yet to try it from a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dr M Conroy

customer_reviews.title: Have a GO on this ones!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!They are SO SO GOOD! Highly recommend they are not just detailed, they are FUN
customer_reviews.author: armando

customer_reviews.title: amazing German product
customer_reviews.text: amazing German product , top tier quality , looks gorgeouse, sounds supreme .So glad that I made correct decision
customer_reviews.author: Nedzhmi

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says, seems dull at top end and clinical to me, probably accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Greeb

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones i've ever had, if you have owned the dt990s and loved them then this is the next step.
customer_reviews.author: J Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Insightful and Precise 🙂
customer_reviews.text: Revealing, rhythmic; slight clamp but not overbearing. Solid pair of headphones. Quite the bargain, all in all.
customer_reviews.author: RTS Cotton

customer_reviews.title: You need a good amplify to drive these
customer_reviews.text: You need a good amplify to drive these, but wow the detail and sound stage and build quality are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: robi reeve

customer_reviews.title: Poor man's Beyerdynamic T1 generation 2
customer_reviews.text: Spending a small fortune, one can enjoy Tesla 2.0 technology deveoped for T1 generation 2. It is easy to drive, I am using a Chord mojo pair with it and it sounds better than anything I heard before. It also can make sound if directly plug it into iphone, but soundstage will be very flat. Beyerdynamic T1 + Chord Hugo probally will sound better than my combo but triple The cost. Update 28 Oct 2016: It is not as comfortable as T90. I somehow feel It is not fully open back.
customer_reviews.author: Kawara

customer_reviews.title: Neat headphones. Little bit too much treble but they're ...
customer_reviews.text: Neat headphones. Little bit too much treble but they're otherwise solid. They're also extremely bright sounding, which is hard to get past when you're used to a warmer sound. The balanced pads help dampen the upper end. If you already own a pair of beyerdynamic headphones there are an obvious upgrade. If you're coming from a different brand, they'll take some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Meatball

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a worth while purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I received the DT 1990 as an upgrade to the ATH M50X and my god are they amazing. The treble can be a tad bright but it is easily fixed with minor EQ adjustments. Even without EQ the level of detail and accuracy is incredible. The mids are just slightly recessed but not enough to detract from performance. Separation of instruments is outstanding and the imaging is very good. The bass is rich and tight with no muddiness to be seen. Bass hits just hard enough to to have noticeable impact and without distracting you from the rhythm of the highs and mids. These are also built like a tank made from Tempurpedic. Very solid. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: In a word... "Spectacular"
customer_reviews.text: I own a plethora of headphones (580/600/650/598/595/M50x/M40x/DT880/DT770/PM3/SHP9500/SRH840/7506/MDR1A/B&OH6ii, and some I can't remember), and THESE take the cake. They are a studio engineer's dream HP. Incredible detail/speed/imaging, with a natural yet spacious soundstage. Maybe too fast/detailed for leisure (depending on taste), but for critical listening, these are tough to beat. Perhaps the best studio HP you can get for mixing/editing/etc. With a high quality "built like a tank" construction, it's built as good as it sounds. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Omega

customer_reviews.title: Astounding tool for audio production.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent headphones. They give a great and accurate representation of sound. I've compared them to some of my favorite monitors in studio and they don't leave you wishing for anything else. Definitely an astounding tool for mixing and really faithful sound for other music production applications in the studio. For audiophiles: these have a pretty wide soundstage, deep and responsive bass (more than the T1s) and despite being 250ohm, they're fairly easy to drive, any simple dac/amp will give you a nice sound. I have them paired with a Schiit Jotunheim and they're just sooo good.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: OMG I'm hearing music for the first time! Granted this is the first higher end headphone set that I've ever owned but wow, it's like a deaf person hearing for the first time!! The balance of lows, mids & highs is perfect and the cool thing is the "layers" (for lack of a better term) of the music, you can mentally see exactly where each instrument is. I've never experienced this before, so cool.
customer_reviews.author: Ed F.

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I really like beyerdynamic. This is my second pair. I’ve had a pair of DT880 pro for about 8 years and wanted to upgrade to their latest model. They just sound so pure and magical. It’s a bit frustrating as a artist to know that most people won’t be able to experience what I’m hearing in the mix unless they toss on a pair of these. I mostly use them while mixing and mastering music and I’ve always felt I can trust beyerdynamic to know what’s going on with my mix. When using other headphone brands, It never really compares to the BD. Btw: These sound Better than the DT880’s :)
customer_reviews.author: D982

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headphones - End-Game for Me
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I've purchased my share of headphones and have always wanted something "more". After reading the reviews, and a helpful post on Reddit, I decided to make the purchase, and, wow... these are fantastic headphones. For an open back set of cans, these are quite amazing. Sub base in open back cans? Yup. Detailed highs. Check. Mids are slightly recessed but still very very good. These are exactly what I've been looking for. I'm sure there are better cans out there, for a price, but these are my end-game (at least until they wear out). Just a wonderful sound no matter what I throw at them... Hats off to Beyerdynamic.
customer_reviews.author: mcshaken

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to recommend spending 600 dollars on any pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to recommend spending 600 dollars on any pair of headphones, and yet I sat here for half and hour thinking of ways I could persuade more people to buy these dynamite headphones. In the end I think that says more about my impression of these headphones than any long winded review would. If you love your ears, buy these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: For the price probably best headphones one can get
customer_reviews.text: For the price probably best headphones one can get. Nearest contender, in my book at least, is Grado PS500e, priced identically. These Beyers are built like a tank, very solid, robust phones. Sound is great as you can read in numerous reviews elsewhere. The only complaint is that the clamp may be a bit strong for certain head sizes (such as mine :-)) Humor aside, these are great phones, best for the price no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Blazek

customer_reviews.title: Long time audiophile's favorite cans
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many high end headphones over the years and these are by far my favorite. Superb build quality, easy to drive (even sound good from weaker sources like an iPad surprisingly)... but really open up with the beyerdynamic A20 amp. I cannot recommend these highly enough, if I could give 6 stars - I would. And I've been in this hobby since the 90's.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Wow. We already had Beyerdynamic DT880 and these are way more impressive. You can hear the soundscape better and can even visualize the shape of the room where music was recorded. Everything you've heard about these is true. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: butters

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've EVER listened to bar none
customer_reviews.text: Buy them, stop reading reviews, and buy them. They are absolutely amazing. My ears are virgins and these headphones are my first booty call. You all know the feeling. Maybe it was 20 years ago, but you always remember your first time (unless you were super drunk). You won't be drunk when you slide these on your head for the first time. OHHH YEAA, every spot hits just right, the sound is magical. The spacing is pristine. Please do yourself a favor this year, make 2020 the year you lost your virginity again. You can tell your bros, and get all the high fives and clout you deserve.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great for ACCURATE sound reproduction and gaming. But not as good as the dt900 pros at sound stage.
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect headphones and anyone who picks apart little pointless details is either being paid by another company or is just a huge snob. These sound beautiful and may make you cry if you've never listened to music on HIFI headphones. Good for gaming too. I play a lot of Squad and that game depends on being able to hear the location of gunshots and advance towards the fight. I will say that after swapping these and the Dt900 Pros during playing I can tell a sliiiiigght reduction in the open sound stage, hardly noticable. They're semi-open-back., as opposed to true open back. Very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome
customer_reviews.text: These the best sounding and even better built headphones I've ever used. edit: since they are 250 ohm it is recommended you get an amp for them... I ended up going with the sound blaster x G6. with that amp on high gain, I don't have to put my volume above 25% for it to be super loud.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile headphones at a medium range price
customer_reviews.text: My upgrade path: Beats Solo HD>Bose QC35 ii>Audeze Mobius>Audeze iSine20>Beyerdynamic DT 1990 Pro I have to say this headphones are a serious upgrade for me based on my path above. I've never heard anything as crisp and detailed as this set. Of course you need a good amount to drive this 250 Ohm headphones and I have that covered with the Astell&Kern KANN Cube which comes with the ability to drive such headphones with it's built in Amp and top quality DAC. The headphones pretty much can make any genre sound good and my listening experience overall is an enjoyable one everyday now.
customer_reviews.author: Joshie

customer_reviews.title: Clear
customer_reviews.text: Crystal clear sound. I usually gravitate towards headphones with sound signatures that are more bass forward, but this is just so well balanced and detailed that I'm at a loss for words. The analytical pads are more comfortable than the balanced pads and while the sound of the analytical pads basically brings some of the low end rumble down a bit, it also seems to make the treble behave a bit better on sharp recordings. Seriously great headphones.
customer_reviews.author: cothealiv

customer_reviews.title: Distorted Audio
customer_reviews.text: If you EQ the bass up (or EQ down the highs/mids to achieve the same effect, but at a lower volume and with less quality loss) these things will distort during bass-heavy moments such as explosions, etc. They sound good, but honestly this makes them pretty unusable in some scenarios. I normally wouldn't complain, but given the $600 price point I find this unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My End Game!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for decent headphones that wasn't going to break the bank nor sounds like crap. I wanted a neutral sounding headphone that was build to last. The build quality of the DT-1990 are just amazing, the clamping force is a bit strong but after a month of so it easy up. The cables it came with are solid (even though it took FOREVER for it to straight out) Wearing these 10+ hours and was not uncomfortable at all. They do come with two different pads, and I found the analytical pads had just a bit more bass if you need just a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Eternal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, top build quality
customer_reviews.text: I was using the Sennheiser HD 280 Pro headphones before this, and it’s like a blanket was taken off of my ears. The highs and the mids are all of a sudden crystal clear. Listening back to my old mixes, I can hear all of the mistakes I’ve made. My only wish was that the cups went fully over my ears, but they’re otherwise very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Incremental upgrade from DT990 but still amazing
customer_reviews.text: For perspective my previous headphones include the B&O H5, DT990 pro 250ohm. My DAC is a Topping D50s and my amp is a SMSL SP200. I had owned the 990s for almost 4 years. The sound staging is the first thing you will notice compared to the DT990's. You will find yourself hearing one or two things you didnt know existed in your music. I am very happy with the DT1990s and the incremental upgrade it provided. That being said if you have a lower budget and have not moved to this type of level yet I would start with the 990s and save your money to focus on better dac and amp.
customer_reviews.author: Garou666

customer_reviews.title: You want the best, you got the best
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones ever created. Best all around! Amazing...End game headphones for me. Just sold my HD 800s
customer_reviews.author: Darin Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic studio reference sound
customer_reviews.text: Short version? These are fantastic neutral sounding professional mixing headphones and are amazing for analytical listening. Long version? Check out Z Reviews and Joshua Valour’s reviews of these headphones and you’ll be even more sold
customer_reviews.author: I. Sommerlot

customer_reviews.title: Endgame?
customer_reviews.text: Lots of earhours with the Hd580-650,hifiman he400i: As Dusty said "is that all there is?" These DT 1990's are a big step above, as in take the old schools out in the back garden,shoot in the head,bury in a shallow grave. My chain is modest :Tidal and Qobuz > Eitr>Modi Multibit v.2>Loki>MCTH (with LPS). Or analog thru a Pro10 MC headphone out. (Unsung hero pre from the early 90's, class A with a remote LPS) Anyhoo, do not overlook these cans, especially as they can be had for around $450. You will need to spend double this amount to get to the next level above the $200 cans in today's market.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Rogers

customer_reviews.title: DT 1990 pro! great sounding headphones !
customer_reviews.text: Great Balance Headphones! i got it on sale and with my Amazon points ! for about $450 ! great headphones and super happy! Im using it with IFI DSD Black Label DAC/AMP and my SONY WALKMAN NW- WM1A!! for long periods of listening.. the top tip of my ears is a little sore. But ppl have different sizes of ears. So.. but I highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Randz

customer_reviews.title: What can i say, they're perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This pair of headphones are some of the most enjoyable headphones I've ever worn. Every song I listen to seems as though they have been given life. Compared to other headphones that I have owned, this is by far the king. I don't know how other headphones can produce a sound better than these. Bravo
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Expansive and expensive quality but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: These are superb headphones. I’ve slowly been moving up the price ladder over the last 2-3 years. But for overall quality these are insane, using them for gaming and music listening is incredible. 3 hours of continuous wearing doesn’t even begin to bother me. Bought with an audioengine usb DAC which also livened them up! If you have the cash they are totally worth it. Large beautiful sound stage.
customer_reviews.author: Colbe Wells

customer_reviews.title: Favorite pair of headphones I own
customer_reviews.text: After using the DT 990 Pro's 250ohm for over 3 years, and many other headphones, I finally caved and bought the 1990s. And wow what a difference from the 990's. Build quality is night and day, sound quality is much much better as well. I'm running these with a Schiit Modi 3, and a Schiit Vali 2. The perfect combination at this point for sound. Highly recommended to anyone considering an upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Branden

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like them
customer_reviews.text: They crushed my head and made my ear hurt for the following weeks even after I stopped using them. The sound quality was fantastic and my DAC really drove them well but they just hurt my head. completely unusable for me.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great, but i have a slight issue
customer_reviews.text: Great Pair of headphones. I’d recommend these to anyone. HOWEVER 1 week in and I feel my pair possibly may be defective. I get heavy Distortion/Rumble in my left ear cup when Lows (Subs/Bass/808s) play when playing music. And Its not plugged into any amp neither i have it plugged into my iphone. Its pretty annoying tbh. i tried L/R panning to see if the right ear cup rumbles but it doesnt it seems to be only the left ear cup unless its designed to do that. I will contact the company and ask them what to do
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius B.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING FOR MIXING
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as my Open-Back mixing set of cans. They are just perfect. Very transparent. Very defined in the bass. Super comfortable. They breathe (if that makes sense.) Have not gotten fatigued while mixing with them. So glad I save my gift cards for these! haha. Driving them with an Audient ID22 interface. Definately have to push the volume knob a little higher than normal but that's ok. May purchase a dedicated headphone amp soon.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Great Set of Cans. A Little Tight on Big Heads
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy material and sound from these. Comes with a nice case I'll never use and a springy corkscrew cord as well as a longer straight cord. Comes with two sets of ear pads too. My only gripe is that I have a bit of a big head and when I first got these it was a little on the tight side and needed some breaking in.
customer_reviews.author: TedBrogan

customer_reviews.title: Pro sound is right
customer_reviews.text: After several returns of headphones, I’ve decided to keep these. Fantastic sound and I’m only using the headphone jack from audioengine speakers HD3 which it does have an internal dac/amp btw. I ordered another dac/amp combo to see if there’s any difference (Topping L30/E30). FYI These headphones are not for first time users.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Carvajal

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Have these running through a JDS Labs Atom amp and they sound incredible. Worth every penny. Edit: Motherboard > EL DAC via USB > Atom Amp
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: High quality and great sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound way better than my DT 990 Premium Edition 250 ohm. I have these headphones hooked up to the Schiit stack consisting of a Magni 3 and a Modi 3.
customer_reviews.author: bigc

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING... and an unfortunate result
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give these headphones all 5 stars. Because they straight up deserve them. One of the best headphones in its price range I've ever heard! The reason for the 1 star is after a couple days, one side went out. Unfortunately got a defective model. I dont blame the headphones at all and I still reccomend them. It's just unfortunate my experience was short lived. I've contacted the seller and hopefully can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT job on this one.
customer_reviews.text: The DT1990 is extremely versatile, and amazingly well built. The sound on the B pads brings up the bass and softens the highs a bit while the A pads bring out the mids/treble and do exactly what they were made for.. analyzing. The B pads are more for every genre, while i feel the A pads are best for classical/vocal/strings..To me it feels like having a super HD600/HD650 although without the intimacy that they provide.. 10/10 for me
customer_reviews.author: kbeau

customer_reviews.title: Best headphone
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding headphones ive owned way better than my Senheiser HD6xx. The DT 1990 pro have a bigger soundstage and is more detailed on the high's not a lot of bass but is still present and is still punchy. I love this headphones my favorite headphone right now
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Way too Bright.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very well built. The sound is way to bright, hurt me ears. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: DJL

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Comes timely and well packed. Love it with my audiophile CDs.
customer_reviews.author: Gumbo

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear Audio
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are just absolutely phenomenal! Far exceeded my expectations! The music makes you feel like you’re actually there as it’s happening! Wouldn’t recommend buying these if you do not already own a headphone amplifier or a receiver. These headphones are just absolutely spectacular and is a must buy for any audiophile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... own 12 pairs of headphones and these are the best ones for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I own 12 pairs of headphones and these are the best ones for gaming, but I still want something better, the sound stage isn’t big enough for me. Was also expecting a little more comfort from beyerdynamic. They are great but I’m still on the quest for better.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Treble spike is real. Improves dramatically with eq
customer_reviews.text: The famous 8k peak is very much present, and as a result everything is rendered with a tinny glare. I can't even watch movies with these headphones. I would never recommend this unless you have access to (and willing to use) a good eq that can target the 8k peak. With the peak removed, this is an excellent headphone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Juhoon Choi

customer_reviews.title: nothing bad to say.
customer_reviews.text: Connecting wire to short. Use for TV and casual listening. Product built very solid. Excellent sound.
customer_reviews.author: tom bielecki

customer_reviews.title: Dt1990 = Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Best set of cans I have ever had. Love gaming In them and listening to music. So much detail, its huge upgrade coming from my HD598. Pricey but worth, if I had a chance to do it over again I would still pick these.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Had to return them
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality but unfortunately had to return because I found it damn near impossible to switch the pads. If it's possible to purchase them with the analytical pads I'd consider getting them again.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Klaister

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome purchase have no regrets paying that $500.00 price tag on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DISTORTION
customer_reviews.text: so i bought an amp and a dac to power it up, and at high volumes theres distortion DO NOT BUY~~~!!!!!! ( at this point i was robbed) enjoy crackily headphones if u want these.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Berardi

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable Experience
customer_reviews.text: First audiophile headphones and I am loving it. Can't get enough. I need to seriously put this down and hangout with my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Turkson

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Transaction
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and good packaging. Thumbs up all around . The headphones sound great!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart B. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best headphones I've used
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best headphones I've used. Not gonna waste your time with a lengthy review since theres plenty out there. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D

customer_reviews.title: They are beautiful. The build quality is just magnificent
customer_reviews.text: They are beautiful. The build quality is just magnificent. They are comfortable. And they sound so good. Crystal clear, tight yet somehow airy. I absolutely love these things.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: 75% headphones, 20% amp, 5% EQ. Pairs ...
customer_reviews.text: 75% headphones, 20% amp, 5% EQ. Pairs perfectly with the Sound Blaster x7 + software. These bangers worked really well just through a standard 3.5mm jack with the bose companion 20, but with the addition of an amp it really started to shine.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Truly amazing. They sound fantastic with a variety of music genres.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing. Purchased for a v-drum kit. Very clear and crisp. Love these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fitzwater

customer_reviews.title: This has the dark sound compared to T90
customer_reviews.text: If you like the dark sound, you may like this. It does have good details. But as I compare this to Beyerdynamic T90, I hear more music from T90. Also, the headband for DT 1990 seemed too tight compare to T90.
customer_reviews.author: Wyu

customer_reviews.title: ... for what they are meant for you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: If you are getting these for what they are meant for you won't be disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.text: The right speaker isn't working after 3 months of use.

product_meta.title: beyerdynamic DT 1990 Pro Open Studio Headphones
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe DT 1990 Pro reference headphones combine these decades of expertise in headphone technology with the latest Tesla driver technology in an open-back design. Thanks to its high-resolution and well-balanced sound The DT 1990 Pro sets new standards, Not least in terms of design and workmanship. As with all beyerdynamic professional studio Headphones, The DT 1990 Pro is also handcrafted in Germany. Backed by high-quality materials and meticulous workmanship, This high-end product is a long-term investment. Together with an ingenious open-back design, The high-resolution Tesla drivers ensure a wide, dynamic and extremely natural stereo image. Titanium-coated acoustic fabric and carefully selected precision-woven textiles round off the balanced sound quality. Natural and exceptionally Spatial Sound is achieved thanks to the open-back design. The optimized Spatial Sound reproduction makes the DT 1990 Pro headphones a reliable reference for mixing and mastering applications as well as for critical listening. Choose between a well-balanced sound or Analytical sound thanks to replaceable velour ear pads. Both ear pad variants are included to finish off this impeccable studio headphone package.
feature_bullets: Open studio reference class headphones for mixing and mastering, Made in Germany
250 ohms, 45 mm dynamic Tesla neodymium drivers
Single sided, detachable cable with mini-XLR connectors
Soft, replaceable ear pads and headband for long studio sessions. Headphone frequency response : 5-40,000 Hz. Nominal sound pressure level : 102 dBSPL (1mW/500Hz)
Delivery contents: 2 ear pads with different sound characteristics (analytical and well-balanced), two pairs of cables (3m straight and coiled), premium hard case
Included Components: Set Of Ear Pads, Headphone, And Two Cables
